I have an Ant build script that uses the "junit" task.  It would be
conveni=
ent if I could send "parameters" to certain unit test classes,
from values =
determined by Ant properties.

For instance, I have a test that uses Derby,=
 which has to set up the
tables it's going to read.  Ideally, I would have =
used the "sql" task
from Ant, but I'm finding that there's some issue with =
that task holding
on to the database connection, which causes the connectio=
n from my unit
test to fail.  So, I found that it works if I do all the db =
init in my
unit test class.  What makes that messy is that I have to issue =
the
"create table" calls.  If I have to do that from inside the class, I'd
=
like to pass in the path to a script instead of hardcoding that inline.
I c=
ould just use a system property, but I'm wondering if there's a
better way.=


I'm currently using JUnit 4.7.
